study_plan_entry.title: Dynamic Nuclear Polarization for NMR spectroscopy

free_text.Learning outcomes: Dynamic Nuclear Polarization provides a way to improve NMR signals by up to 4 orders of magnitude. We present the current state-of-the-art of this technique available at EPFL LRMB. We aim to meet the current practical interest of the EPFL community to improve sensitivity in NMR.
free_text.Content: Day 1: [br/]1. Theoretical aspects of DNP[br/]  [li] Introduction to DNP-enhanced NMR[br/]  [li] Principles of Dissolution DNP[br/]  [li] Principles of Solid state DNP[br/]  [li]Applications in imaging and chemistry [br/][br/]2. Experimental aspects of DNP[br/]   [li] Hardware for Dissolution DNP[br/]   [li] Hardware for Solid state DNP [br/]   [li] Sample Preparation[br/][br/]Day 2: [br/]3. Practical DNP at LRMB[br/]   [li] Students prepare samples, set up the NMR spectrometer, and perform dissolution DNP experiments at LRMB[br/][br/]4. Student presentations[br/]   [li] Students give a short presentation (5 slides) on possible applications of DNP to enhance their own research subjects.
